intro: Hieracium pendulifrons, commonly known as the hanging hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green to white ray florets, and it produces small, elongated achenes as seeds. Hieracium pendulifrons is often found in sunny, well-drained soils and is known for its delicate, pendulous appearance.
